name: Centralized Logging with OpenSearch
title: Centralized Logging with OpenSearch

bottom.copy: Amazon Web Services, Inc. or its affiliates. All rights reserved.

tag.name: Tags
tag.desc: A tag is a label that you assign to an AWS resource. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value. You can use tags to search and filter your resources or track your AWS costs.
tag.noTagDesc: No tags associated with the resource.
tag.tagFilterDesc: Enter a tag key and value applied to the resources you want to target (maximum 5), and then choose Add.

monitoring.title: Monitoring
monitoring.lightEngineSvcLambdaDesc: Retrieve log files from the log bucket configured by {{service}}, and copy these files to the Staging bucket
monitoring.lightEngineAppLambdaDesc: Retrieve log files from the log buffer layer and copy these files to the Staging bucket

metrics.SQSApproximateNumberOfMessagesVisible: SQS Approximate Number of Messages Visible
metrics.FailedLogs: Number of logs failed to process
metrics.LoadedLogs: Number of logs are loaded successfully

logging.desc: This tab provides you quick access to the logs of the two lambdas in the pipeline that loads logs into the OpenSearch domain, making it easy for you to troubleshoot log ingestion failures.
logging.filterPlaceHolder: Filter log stream or try prefix search
logging.errorLogDesc: You can find record-level error information in below S3 location.
logging.hasOlder: There are older events to load.
logging.noOlder: No older events at this moment.
logging.hasNewer: There are newer events to load.
logging.noNewer: No newer events at this moment.

alarm.createTitleDesc: The solution will collect metrics to monitor the log pipeline status, and it provides a set of recommended alarms to notify you if any anomaly detected. Please note that additional charge will apply if enabled alarms.
alarm.titleDesc: The solution provides a set of alarms that are useful to monitor the ingestion pipeline.
alarm.emailDesc: Please provide email address for the newly-created SNS topic to notify.
alarm.notificationDesc: Select a SNS topic as the destination for alarm notifications, you can then create subscriptions to forward the notification to different platform (e.g., email, webhook).
alarm.notSupport: Pipeline Alarm does not support this service log
alarm.expandPresetAlarm: Expand to view all preset alarms
alarm.topicNameDesc: Maximum 128 characters. Can include alphanumeric characters, hyphens (-) and underscores (_)

list.PROCESSOR_ERROR_INVOCATION_ALARM: Error invocation #  >= 10 for 5 minutes, 1 consecutive time
list.PROCESSOR_ERROR_RECORD_ALARM: Failed record # >= 1  for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time
list.PROCESSOR_DURATION_ALARM: Average execution duration in last 5 minutes >= 60000 milliseconds
list.FLUENTBIT_OUTPUT_RETRIED_RECORDS_ALARM: Fluent Bit output_retried_record_total >= 100 for last 5 minutes
list.KDS_THROTTLED_RECORDS_ALARM: KDS PutRecord throttled # >= 10 for 1 minute, 1 consecutive time

error.emailInvalid: Email must be a validate format

processor.serviceUnavailable: OpenSearch Ingestion Service is not supported in the current region, the log processor will use Lambda functions.
processor.onlySupportLambda: Log Processor using Lambda functions when pipeline is light engine.
processor.lambdaDesc: Logs will be processed and ingested using Lambda function. Pay as you go, charged by lambda processing compute and memory based on usage. Use this if you have small and burst log volume or no need of further processing on logs.
processor.osiDesc: Logs will be processed and ingested by OpenSearch Ingestion Service. You pay by the provisioned Ingestion Capacity Unit. Use this if you expect advanced processing (e.g., sampling, multi-route) on logs before ingestion into OpenSearch.
processor.pipelineCapacityDesc: A single Ingestion OpenSearch Compute Unit (OCU) represents billable compute and memory units. You are charged an hourly rate based on the number of OCUs used to run your data pipelines.
processor.minMaxTips: Minimum and maximum capacity must be positive numbers between 1 and 96. The maximum capacity limit for stateful pipelines(for example, those that use the service_map or aggregate processor) is 48.
processor.disabledEnrich: Enriched fields are not applicable in OSI model.

maxmindCopyRight: This product includes GeoLite2 data created by MaxMind, available from
reloginTips: You were signed out of your account. Please press Reload to sign in again.
archDesc: The architecture diagram to ingest log data into OpenSearch domain.
lightEngineArchDesc: The architecture diagram to ingest log data into Light Engine.

error.logSourceAlreadyExists: The log source name already exists
error.timeFormatShouldNotBeEmpty: Time format should not be empty if the field type is date.
error.indexNameEmpty: Index name must not be empty
error.invalidIndexName: Invalid index name. Please use a lowercase string that does not begin with a number.
error.sideCarPathInvalid: In sidecar mode, log paths must share the same path. For example, '/var/log/access.log, /var/log/error.log' is acceptable, '/var/log/access.log, /var/error/error.log' is not acceptable.
error.filePathNotBegin: File path must not begin with /(slash)
error.filePathContainStar: File path can only contain at most one *

moreDetailsGoToCloudformation: More details, please go to Cloudformation event
